findings.description: Private key found in source code. This is a critical security issue.
findings.remediation: Remove private keys from source code. Use secure key management (HSM, vault).
findings.impact: Critical: Exposed cryptographic secrets can lead to complete system compromise
findings.effort: Immediate action required - rotate secrets and remove from code

findings.remediation: Remove from source. Plan migration to ML-DSA keys.

findings.effort: Inventory: Add to CBOM, verify algorithm meets requirements

recommendations: CRITICAL: Remove broken algorithms (MD5, SHA-1, DES, RC4) immediately.
Plan migration from quantum-vulnerable algorithms to PQC (ML-KEM, ML-DSA).
Consider hybrid cryptography as a transition strategy.

insights.title: RSA Migration Required (12 instances)
insights.description: RSA is quantum-vulnerable and will be broken by Shor's algorithm. All RSA usage must migrate to ML-KEM (FIPS 203) for key encapsulation.
insights.action:
1. Inventory all RSA usage
2. Implement hybrid RSA+ML-KEM during transition
3. Complete migration to pure ML-KEM by 2030

insights.title: ECC/ECDSA Migration Required (6 instances)
insights.description: Elliptic curve cryptography is quantum-vulnerable. Signatures must migrate to ML-DSA (FIPS 204) or SLH-DSA (FIPS 205).
insights.action:
1. Identify ECC usage (signatures vs key exchange)
2. For signatures: migrate to ML-DSA
3. For key exchange: migrate to ML-KEM

insights.title: Private Keys/Secrets Exposed (2 instances)
insights.description: Private keys or secrets found in source code. This is a critical security issue requiring immediate action.
insights.action:
1. Immediately rotate all exposed credentials
2. Remove secrets from source code
3. Use secrets management (Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, etc.)
